name: Chapter 7:Amazon SNS – Message Distribution
description: Flashcards to understand Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) using pizza shop metaphors.

cards.front: You want to send the same notification to all subscribers regardless of their interest. How does Amazon SNS handle this?
cards.back: Use a single SNS topic. All subscribers receive every message published to that topic, regardless of their preferences.
cards.example: A pizza shop sends a single newsletter with coupons, trivia, and new menu items to everyone, whether they care or not.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Cloud Support Essentials: A Technical Approach

glossary.definition: A fully managed pub/sub messaging service that enables message distribution to multiple subscribers.
A channel for message delivery in SNS.

cards.front: How can you send different types of messages to different groups using Amazon SNS?
cards.back: Create multiple SNS topics, each targeting a specific message type or audience. Subscribers choose only the topics they care about.
cards.example: A pizza shop sends separate newsletters for coupons, trivia, and product updates so customers can pick what they receive.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Cloud Support Essentials: A Technical Approach

glossary.definition: An SNS setup where each topic is focused on a specific category, enabling targeted delivery.
The recipient of messages published to an SNS topic.

cards.front: You're sending one message to be received by email, SMS, a web app, and a Lambda function. How does Amazon SNS support this?
cards.back: SNS supports multiple endpoints, allowing a single published message to be delivered across various channels like email, SMS, Lambda, and HTTP/S.
cards.example: A pizza coupon is sent by email to customers, displayed on the kitchen monitor, posted to a website, and pushed to mobile—all from one SNS message.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Cloud Support Essentials: A Technical Approach

glossary.definition: The destination for an SNS message, such as email, Lambda, HTTP/S, SMS, or SQS.
The entity that sends messages to an SNS topic.
